850053882:
[

Service Desk Analyst

Company Name Ethan Group Company Location Melbourne, Australia

Posted Date Posted 1 week ago Number of views 181 views

Job description

The Company


Ethan Group is one of the largest privately-owned service providers within the Australian ICT industry. Known for our entrepreneurial spirit and can-do culture, we pride ourselves on our innovative thinking and best-in-class service.


We need a competent Service Desk Analyst to join our growing Global Service Desk Team; who is available to work on a 24/7 rotating work roster, to ensure that customer service is provided at the highest standard, within contracted service level agreements and scope of contracts.


Our Service Desk Analysts are tasked with being the first technical contact on support issues and a key objective is to provide first call fix capabilities to callers and other electronically submitted requests in order to fulfil client demand and achieve business objectives.

\xa0

Roles & Responsibilities:


Key responsibilities include:


  • Identify and resolve requests for technical assistance via phone and remote support tools, in an effective and timely manner;
  • Analyse, identify, diagnose, and troubleshoot user desktop technical issues and network faults;
  • Perform desktop and server administration, configurations, software installations, upgrades, maintenance and backups;
  • Perform basic administration tasks (such as password resets, account creations/deletions) as defined in the specific customer configuration work rules;
  • Document all service desk interactions in our ITSM tool (Connectwise);
  • Participate in creating technical documents and uploading into knowledge base; and
  • Identify and escalate more complex problems or urgent situations to appropriate senior resources or other departments.


Skills, Experience & Qualifications

  • Previous experience as a Service Desk Agent or Customer Service Representative desirable;
  • Experience with Microsoft Office Suite 2007, 2010, 2013, Microsoft Active Directory, Exchange and Citrix;
  • Understanding of Network troubleshooting for ADSL routers, and using service support systems;
  • Previous use of ConnectWise ITSM tool or another similar ticketing system preferred;
  • ITIL Qualification or ITIL exposure preferred; and
  • Industry vendor certifications highly regarded (Microsoft MCP, CISCO, Citrix etc).


Desired Personal Attributes:


  • Must have strong time management skills and the ability to perform well under pressure handling simultaneous assignments;

  • Ability to deal with difficult customers and build sound relationships with key stakeholders;

  • Possess excellent verbal and written communication skills;

  • Strong critical thinking ability and problem resolution skills;

  • Strong procedural and organisational skills, paying high attention to detail; and

  • A strong team player, who is willing to contribute to achieving team and organisational objectives.



Do you meet the above selection criteria? Would you like to be rewarded in line with your qualifications and experience? Are you interested in an opportunity to grow in your role whilst working in a fun, engaged and flexible environment?


If yes, then this is the opportunity for you! Apply today for this exciting position with Ethan Group.


Ethan Group strongly encourage Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander candidates to apply.



*No Agencies, Thank You**

\xa0

852233813:
[

Marketing Coordinator

Company Name Munro Footwear Group Company Location Port Melbourne, Victoria, Australia

Posted Date Posted 1 week ago Number of views 472 views

Job description

Munro Footwear Group (MFG) is Australia's leading retailer and wholesaler of footwear, owning and operating Australia's most iconic brands. Our impressive portfolio includes Midas, Mollini, Mountfords, Wanted, Williams, Mathers, diana ferrari as well as Australia's most popular online footwear retailer, Styletread!


As we enter an exciting era, an opportunity now exists for an enthusiastic Marketing Coordinator\xa0to join our team, supporting and coordinating all marketing activities.

\xa0

This is a perfect position for an entry level marketing professional who is looking to establish themselves within the retail industry. The role will require a candidate who is happy to manage a wide variety of marketing objectives, in particular, looking after store based as well as national marketing initiatives, new store openings and communication between head office and our retail stores.

\xa0

Proven organisational and communication skills, as well as the capacity to adapt to change and a fast pace will also be key. If you have an eye for detail, ability to work with multiple stakeholders and enthusiasm for learning, then this could be your opportunity to launch your marketing career with a growing retail company.


Your responsibilities will include:

  • Planning and coordination of store marketing activity.
  • Co-ordinate all local marketing initiatives and ensure that the brands are represented throughout all the available local marketing channels.
  • Evaluate, co-ordinate and track store marketing requests
  • Work closely with the Property team in the lead up to new store openings and refurbishments
  • Liaise with VM, online department and stores to ensure all advertised product is available and in stock from the launch of each promotion
  • Collate quotes from a number of suppliers in a timely manner (print, digital, gift with purchase)
  • Coordinate the weekly eDM program including liaising with the merchandise team, briefing creative, providing feedback, and managing approval processes
  • Track and file all marketing invoices and ensure they are aligned with the quotes
  • Manage product imagery for PR/Centre marketing purposes
  • Assistance to the GM marketing in administration of the marketing department

To be successful you will have:

  • Extremely organised and deadline focused
  • Strong communication skills
  • Team player – hands on environment and a can-do attitude
  • Understanding of the retail in store environment and requirements
  • Willingness to take ownership and responsibility
  • Strong organisational skills with high attention to detail
  • Demonstrated experience in being accountable for projects from inception through to delivery


This is the ideal role to develop your career within our dynamic and friendly marketing team! If this sounds like the role for you, don't delay and APPLY\xa0NOW!


Due to the high volume of applications we receive the vacancy close date may change, don't delay and APPLY NOW!


Please note we will not be accepting applicants put forward through agencies, if you are interested in the role please apply directly, we would love to hear from you!

856354483:
[

Evaluation Engineer

Company Name Bayside Group Automotive Company Location South Eastern Suburbs Melbourne, Australia

Posted Date Posted 6 days ago Number of views 68 views

Be an early applicant

Job description


An exciting opportunity exists for an Evaluation Engineer (Light Vehicle & Parts) to join a large OEM company within their Product and Development Division.


Working as part of a team, you'll be involved in the testing of vehicles and parts in natural environments across Australia. In this role you'll be primarily responsible for the acquisition and analysis of data relating to vehicle dynamic control systems utilising tools.


You'll be part of an expanding area of the business working on global vehicle projects.


The ability to travel for extended periods (including remote locations) is essential.


Working with the Vehicle Evaluation and Development Team you will be responsible for

  • Supporting the lead engineer with the implementation of agreed vehicle test processes to achieve vehicle evaluation objectives
  • Overseeing the planning and reporting of tests to produce meaningful and accurate data
  • Translating large amounts of information into reports to share with senior stakeholders
  • Meeting project deliverables within timeframes, maintaining safety standards
  • Working as part of a passionate team to complete divisional targets


Requirements:

  • Engineering degree
  • High proficiency with Matlab and Excel
  • Data acquisition, control system and signal processing skills
  • Visual Basic and C Programming skills would be an advantage
  • Current driver's license, off-road driving experience would be an advantage
  • Flexibility to travel regularly
  • Effective communication and interpersonal skills


To submit your application in strict confidence, click the 'apply' button. If you require further information, please contact Aaron Williams on 03 9864 6000.


To view all automotive job opportunities, visit www.baysidegroupautomotive.com.au

Maintenance Fitter

Company Name Ridley Corporation Ltd Company Location Lara, AU

Posted Date Posted 7 days ago Number of views 81 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

Job Details
  • Fantastic Career opportunity
  • Permanent full-time
  • Dayshift position and roster to support call outs

Who we are?

Ridley is a publicly listed Australian company, manufacturing stockfeed from 24 sites across Australia. The Lara site is the newest operation of the company and is achieving new benchmarks of productivity and energy efficiency. The site supplies the chicken and pork industry of south west Victoria, using state of the art equipment in a high volume, highly automated process.

What's on offer?

We have a vacancy for a mechanical fitter for the Lara operation. The role is a full-time permanent day shift role supporting a 5 day operation. In addition to equipment repair and maintenance, this role offers the opportunity to be involved in the establishment and improvement of preventative maintenance programs, underpinned by optimum use of a computerised maintenance management system.

We are seeking a mechanical fitter with experience in process industries, an ability to work independently as required and with an interest in being involved in developing and maintaining a preventative maintenance program.

You will have

  • A mechanical Trade qualification- essential (Relevant tickets to perform tasks)
  • Demonstrated knowledge of OH&S and Environmental Policies and Legislation
  • Ability to work independently
  • 3+years Industry Experience (History working with manufacturing)
  • Sound computer skills - Microsoft Office, AX and Guardian programs will be used
  • Organizational and time management skills
  • Good reading, numeracy and problem solving skills

If this is you, please click 'apply now' and provide both your resume and cover letter. Upon receipt of your application you will receive an email with our pre-screening questions (please ensure you check your junk email). Shortlisted candidates will be required to undertake online psychometric testing and a comprehensive pre-employment medical (including drug and alcohol testing). Open to applicants with unrestricted work rights in Australia.

Internship - Dealer Sales

Company Name Mercedes-Benz Australia Company Location Melbourne, Australia

Posted Date Posted 6 days ago Number of views 519 views

Job description

The opportunity

There has never been a more exciting time to join Mercedes-Benz Vans! The recent launch of our new X-Class and upcoming launch of our Sprinter van keeps our small and dynamic Dealer Sales team busy, challenged and engaged.


Reporting to the Campaign & Remarketing Manager, this Internship will provide the opportunity to gain hands-on experience, as well as exposure to strategic business initiatives that will continue to grow our success.

\xa0

Key responsibilities include:

  • Co-ordinate and track demo, press and company fleet vehicles

  • Administration support for vehicles, including registration and renewals, tolls and fines management and fuel management

  • Support Campaign & Remarketing Manager with administration of pre-owned vehicle systems, and lease return vehicle management

  • Analytics and administration support for sales campaign planning

  • General administration support to the sales team


This Internship will also provide the opportunity to gain a strong understanding and experience within the automotive industry, campaign analytics, incentive programs and exposure to different applications and system (e.g. SAP).

\xa0\xa0

Who we’re looking for

A successful candidate for this great opportunity will have a desire to learn, be curious in nature and ready to roll up their sleeves and be involved in a fast-pace environment where no two days are the same. A high attention to detail, strong communication skills and an ability to think on your feet will be essential for success. \xa0

\xa0

We will be considering candidates with degree-qualified (or in final year of completion) applicants. Studies within Business and Marketing will be favourable.

\xa0

If you’re ready to take on this challenge and want to grow your career with Mercedes-Benz Vans, please apply with your cover letter and resume by Sunday 16 September 2018.

Aquatic School Programs Supervisor

Company Name Glen Eira City Council Company Location Glen Eira, Australia

Posted Date Posted 6 days ago Number of views 22 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

Job Details
  • $55K p.a + super
  • Fun and exciting team environment
  • Opportunity for career development

Glen Eira City Council has an opportunity to join Glen Eira Leisure's (GEL) aquatic team. GEL facilities include Glen Eira Sports and Aquatic Centre, Caulfield Recreation Centre, and Carnegie Swim Centre. The facilities provide programs and services to improve community health and features state of the art aquatic, fitness, sports, and rehabilitation facilities and a brand new premium spa and Wellness Centre.

Do you have a love of the water?

Are you passionate about working in a team environment?

Are you motivated to grow aquatic education programs?

If that sounds like you, we are looking for a highly motivated & organised professional to join our team as an Aquatic School Programs Supervisor. The position assists the Aquatic Programs Team Leader in managing all GEL aquatic programs and services, with a specific focus on our schools intensive program, leisure activities and special events. Our ideal candidate will have demonstrated experience in a similar role within the aquatics and leisure industry.

This is a full time role operating on a Sunday - Thursday roster with flexible hours available.

As The Aquatic School Programs Supervisor, You Will Have
  • Ability to work flexible hours including weekends, mornings and evenings.
  • Demonstrated experience in managing and growing aquatic education programs
  • Demonstrate customer service skills and experience in leading a team
  • Well-developed problem-solving and attention to detail skills.
  • Sound negotiation skills and the ability to diplomatically handle conflict both from staff and customers.
  • Experience with Point Of Sale Systems
  • First Aid Level 2 and CPR qualifications

Please note applicants must be willing to undergo a Police records check and a work based medical. Applicants are also required to hold a current employee working with children check .

To view a copy of the position description visit www.gleneira.vic.gov.au

For further enquiries please call Clare McCormick on (03) 9575 7123.

All applications must quote Ref. 18/132 and address the selection criteria located in the position description.
